extendedIngredients.name: sharp cheddar cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups mild or sharp cheddar cheese

recipes.title: Jalapeno Bacon Turkey Burger

winePairing.pairingText: Turkey Burgers works really well with Malbec, Merlot, and Zinfandel. Merlot will be perfectly adequate for a classic burger with standard toppings. Bolder toppings call for bolder wines, such as a malbec or peppery zinfandel. The Gascon Malbec with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 13 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Gascon Malbec
productMatches.description: A classic expression of the grape, our Don Miguel Gasc√≥n Malbec opens with intense aromas of blackberry, plum and a hint of mocha. On the palate, dark fruit flavors are finely intertwined with notes of spice, licorice and chocolate for a magnificent full-bodied Malbec. Round tannins and a plush mouthfeel lead the way to a long, velvety finish.

recipes.instructions: Take turkey burgers out of packaging, sprinkle bacon bits on each side, pressing down to push the bacon into the turkey meat.Using a cast iron skillet or indoor grill, cook turkey burgers until cooked all the way though.In a sauce pan, make a roux with the butter and flour (by whisking the butter and flour for a few minutes until the taste of the flour is gone). Add the jalapenos at the same time.Once the roux is done, add cream and cheddar. Whisk until the cheese is melted and the sauce is creamy.Serve on a bun with the cheese sauce spooned over the turkey burgers.

steps.step: Take turkey burgers out of packaging, sprinkle bacon bits on each side, pressing down to push the bacon into the turkey meat.Using a cast iron skillet or indoor grill, cook turkey burgers until cooked all the way though.In a sauce pan, make a roux with the butter and flour (by whisking the butter and flour for a few minutes until the taste of the flour is gone).
Add the jalapenos at the same time.Once the roux is done, add cream and cheddar.
Whisk until the cheese is melted and the sauce is creamy.
Serve on a bun with the cheese sauce spooned over the turkey burgers.
